conclusion: Understand the geometry of the isosceles prism with vertex angle 30°, side AB length L, light ray DO hitting midpoint O of AB, incident angle 45°, and ray exits perpendicular to AC.
Determine the path length in the prism from O to S on AC.
Calculate the segment length s using trigonometry: s = L/4.
Use Snell's Law to find the refractive index: n = sin(45°)/sin(75°).
Calculate the speed of light in the prism: v = c * sin(75°) / sin(45°).
Determine the propagation time: t = (L/4) / (v * cos(75°)).
Simplify the expression using cos(75°) = sin(15°): t = (sqrt(2) L) / (4c * sin(75°) * sin(15°)).
Final simplification using sin(75°) * sin(15°) = 1/4: t = (sqrt(6) L) / (3c).
The propagation time of light in the prism is t = (sqrt(6) L) / (3c).
